comment: Mrs. Johnson was amazing for lab! She was clear on what you needed to know and what you may expect on the practicals. If you study good for the practicals you should have an easy B for lab!

She is a nice lady, but the tests are really hard and go deep into the material. She gives pictures to memorize, but asks what things do not the names. Be ready to spend many hours studying for her class. It is not about memorizing, but really understanding the material.

Love her!! Anatomy is naturally a tough course to you have to expect to work hard, but Johnson as a professor is very sweet and very approachable to those that show any effort. You can tell she really cares that her students do well. I strongly recommend her!

She's really sweet, but can get visibly flustered sometimes. She complained about how no one would come to class, but all she did was read off of her power points. Her class was really hard and she was not very helpful in describing or guiding you on how to pass her tests and how to study and what to study. I do not and will not recommend her.

Literally the worst teacher I've ever had. The objectives she goes over aren't even on the test. Her office hours are not flexible, so if you have another class at that time you're pretty much screwed. She is not the least bit helpful. Her lectures are confusing. She says one thing, someone asks a question, and she says the complete opposite.

She reads straight from ppts provided by textbook maker, but understands none of what she's reading herself. This s evident because she cannot answer any questions you have on the material. Get ready to hear a lot of her personal stories and write a research paper.
Very tough class. There's tons of material and this class requires lots of study time. She was very nice and helpful, but seemed to get flustered on occasion. Tests were very difficult.

I took Johnson for A&P I and am currently taking her for A&P II.  I think she's great.  This class is difficult regardless of who teaches it.  She doesn't find it necessary to make you show up or every class, do projects, do BS assignments, or try and trip you up on exams.  Study the powerpoints and read from the text anything you need clarity on.

This semester (fall 2014) was her first time teaching anatomy. She's finding her route and I'm taking her again for A2. She's tough & she doesn't know what she is doingsaying but it is not impossible. TALK TO HER.  Anatomy + Lab is just a hard class no matter who is teaching it. Stick with it and GET A STUDY BUDDY. All nighter's happen.

She doesn't teach. She reads. To get into NURSING SCHOOL you don't need to be read to, you need to be taught. Ended up just reading from book with study group. She has to look up the answer to any question you ask about her ppt, but she's quick to waste lecture time (we only have 50 mins!) with her life story. Avoid this "professor".

Prof Johnson is extremely helpful and she will never make you feel like she is too busy in lab for you. She is there to be of assistance, not to do other work. She makes sure you see the things you need to see and know the things you need to know. Anatomy labs are never easy, but she is a good teacher to wade through it with.

I feel that she had no idea what she was talking about. She read straight off the slides that came straight from the book. She was unable to answer with clarity most questions. If you read the book and slides, and study the objectives really well, you should be able to make an A or B.

Dr. Johnson: nice person, not the best teacher. Her slides come straight from the book so you REALLY have to read the book or ppt in detail b4 the test. there are online quizzes (take unlimited) but they help for the test. A&P is not easy. STUDY hard and the test will be fine is got A's & Bs and I studied a night before. Read before class, it helps

AVOID. Reads straight off powerpoints, meaning she doesn't teach the material at all. To get a good grade, read the book IN DETAIL and make study guides for tests based off objectives. Hardest class so far I've ever taken- would be easier if she taught in class rather than teaching myself. Avoid if possible.

Prof. Johnson is nice, but not the best when it comes to teaching the material. I've basically had to teach myself the whole semester. It's a large class so attendance is not mandatory. However, coming to class does help. She will provide clarification on a few things and if asked.  Overall, an average teacher.

She reads directly off the powerpoints and the power points are from the company that made the book. She doesn't add much to help you understand. When I went to her for help, asking what I was doing wrong she just told me most people have to take the class twice anyways and to quit studying so much. She doesn't have many assignments and hard tests.
DO NOT TAKE FOR LAB! If you ask her a question she has to google it. 2 practicals, 100 questions, about 12 chapters each. She does not make things clear. Just don't taker her.

Dr Johnson is very nice and very helpful! She has a total of six tests but assigns less chapters for each test  She usually offers a few extra credit questions on the test too Tests are not super hard but the class in general requires a lot of studying Lectures can feel long but tests usually come straight from the lecture Would recommend!
